content:
StateMachineWorkflowInstance Class

In this Article

Represents a class that manages the current instance of a StateMachineWorkflowActivity. This class cannot be inherited.

Syntax

Declaration

[System.Obsolete("The System.Workflow.* types are deprecated.  Instead, please use the new types from System.Activities.*")]
public sealed class StateMachineWorkflowInstance

Inheritance Hierarchy

  • System.Object
  • StateMachineWorkflowInstance

Inherited Members

Equals(Object)
,
Equals(Object,Object)
,
GetHashCode()
,
GetType()
,
MemberwiseClone()
,
ReferenceEquals(Object,Object)
,
ToString()

Remarks

Note

This material discusses types and namespaces that are obsolete. For more information, see Deprecated Types in Windows Workflow Foundation 4.5.

This class also provides the query interface over the current instance of the StateMachineWorkflowActivity. By using an instance of this class, you can make various queries on the StateMachineWorkflowInstance.

Typical queries that can be made are as follows:

  • Current state of the state machine.

  • Possible transitions from the current state.

  • History of transitions for the state machine instance.

  • Enumeration of all the states in the state machine.

Constructors summary

StateMachineWorkflowInstance(WorkflowRuntime,Guid)

Initializes a new instance of the StateMachineWorkflowInstance class.

Properties summary

CurrentState

Gets the currently executing StateActivity.
CurrentStateName

Gets the name of the current StateActivity.
InstanceId

Gets the Guid that indicates the current instance of the StateMachineWorkflowActivity.
PossibleStateTransitions

Gets a collection of state transitions that the current StateActivity can make.
StateHistory

Gets a collection of state activities that the state machine workflow instance has transitioned through.
StateMachineWorkflow

Gets the latest definition of the StateMachineWorkflowActivity.
States

Gets a list of StateActivity classes in the stem.Workflow.Activities.StateMachineWorkflowInstance.StateMachineWorkflow*.
WorkflowInstance

Gets the current WorkflowInstance.

Constructors

  • StateMachineWorkflowInstance(WorkflowRuntime,Guid)

    Initializes a new instance of the StateMachineWorkflowInstance class.

    public StateMachineWorkflowInstance (System.Workflow.Runtime.WorkflowRuntime runtime, Guid instanceId);

    Parameters

    • runtime
      WorkflowRuntime

      The current workflow runtime.

    • instanceId
      Guid

      The Guid that indicates the instance of the StateMachineWorkflowActivity.

    Exceptions

    • ArgumentNullException

      runtime is a null reference (Nothing in Visual Basic).

      or

      instanceId is an empty Guid.

    Example

    The following example shows how to create a new instance of a StateMachineWorkflowInstance object. This example is from the Ordering State Machine SDK sample. For more information, seeOrdering State Machine Sample. 

    try
{
    List<SqlTrackingWorkflowInstance> queriedWorkflows = new List<SqlTrackingWorkflowInstance>();
    SqlTrackingQuery sqlTrackingQuery = new SqlTrackingQuery(connectionString);
    SqlTrackingQueryOptions sqlTrackingQueryOptions = new SqlTrackingQueryOptions();
    sqlTrackingQueryOptions.StatusMinDateTime = from.ToUniversalTime();
    sqlTrackingQueryOptions.StatusMaxDateTime = until.ToUniversalTime();
    // If QualifiedName, FieldName, or DataValue is not supplied, we will not query since they are all required to match
    if (!((string.Empty == trackingDataItemValue.QualifiedName) || (string.Empty == trackingDataItemValue.FieldName) || ((string.Empty == trackingDataItemValue.DataValue))))
        sqlTrackingQueryOptions.TrackingDataItems.Add(trackingDataItemValue);

    queriedWorkflows.Clear();

    if ("created" == workflowEvent.ToLower(CultureInfo.InvariantCulture))
    {
        sqlTrackingQueryOptions.WorkflowStatus = WorkflowStatus.Created;
        queriedWorkflows.AddRange(sqlTrackingQuery.GetWorkflows(sqlTrackingQueryOptions));
    }
    else if ("completed" == workflowEvent.ToLower(CultureInfo.InvariantCulture))
    {
        sqlTrackingQueryOptions.WorkflowStatus = WorkflowStatus.Completed;
        queriedWorkflows.AddRange(sqlTrackingQuery.GetWorkflows(sqlTrackingQueryOptions));
    }
    else if ("running" == workflowEvent.ToLower(CultureInfo.InvariantCulture))
    {
        sqlTrackingQueryOptions.WorkflowStatus = WorkflowStatus.Running;
        queriedWorkflows.AddRange(sqlTrackingQuery.GetWorkflows(sqlTrackingQueryOptions));
    }
    else if ("suspended" == workflowEvent.ToLower(CultureInfo.InvariantCulture))
    {
        sqlTrackingQueryOptions.WorkflowStatus = WorkflowStatus.Suspended;
        queriedWorkflows.AddRange(sqlTrackingQuery.GetWorkflows(sqlTrackingQueryOptions));
    }
    else if ("terminated" == workflowEvent.ToLower(CultureInfo.InvariantCulture))
    {
        sqlTrackingQueryOptions.WorkflowStatus = WorkflowStatus.Terminated;
        queriedWorkflows.AddRange(sqlTrackingQuery.GetWorkflows(sqlTrackingQueryOptions));
    }
    else if (("all" == workflowEvent.ToLower(CultureInfo.InvariantCulture)) || (string.Empty == workflowEvent) || (null == workflowEvent))
    {
        sqlTrackingQueryOptions.WorkflowStatus = WorkflowStatus.Created;
        queriedWorkflows.AddRange(sqlTrackingQuery.GetWorkflows(sqlTrackingQueryOptions));

        sqlTrackingQueryOptions.WorkflowStatus = WorkflowStatus.Completed;
        queriedWorkflows.AddRange(sqlTrackingQuery.GetWorkflows(sqlTrackingQueryOptions));

        sqlTrackingQueryOptions.WorkflowStatus = WorkflowStatus.Running;
        queriedWorkflows.AddRange(sqlTrackingQuery.GetWorkflows(sqlTrackingQueryOptions));

        sqlTrackingQueryOptions.WorkflowStatus = WorkflowStatus.Suspended;
        queriedWorkflows.AddRange(sqlTrackingQuery.GetWorkflows(sqlTrackingQueryOptions));

        sqlTrackingQueryOptions.WorkflowStatus = WorkflowStatus.Terminated;
        queriedWorkflows.AddRange(sqlTrackingQuery.GetWorkflows(sqlTrackingQueryOptions));

    }
    return queriedWorkflows;

}
catch (Exception exception)
{
    throw new Exception("Exception in GetWorkflows", exception);
}

Properties

  • CurrentState

    Gets the currently executing StateActivity.

    public System.Workflow.Activities.StateActivity CurrentState { get; }

    Property Value

    • StateActivity

      The current StateActivity.

  • CurrentStateName

    Gets the name of the current StateActivity.

    public string CurrentStateName { get; }

    Property Value

    • String

      The name of the current StateActivity.

  • InstanceId

    Gets the Guid that indicates the current instance of the StateMachineWorkflowActivity.

    public Guid InstanceId { get; }

    Property Value

    • Guid

      The Guid that indicates the current instance of the StateMachineWorkflowActivity.

  • PossibleStateTransitions

    Gets a collection of state transitions that the current StateActivity can make.

    public System.Collections.ObjectModel.ReadOnlyCollection<string> PossibleStateTransitions { get; }

    Property Value

    • ReadOnlyCollection<String>

      A collection of state transitions that the current StateActivity can make.

  • StateHistory

    Gets a collection of state activities that the state machine workflow instance has transitioned through.

    public System.Collections.ObjectModel.ReadOnlyCollection<string> StateHistory { get; }

    Property Value

    • ReadOnlyCollection<String>

      A collection of transitions that the StateActivity has made.

    Remarks

    This property only returns the state history if the SqlTrackingService is used. An InvalidOperationException occurs if the SqlTrackingService is not installed. If there is no state history for a newly created instance, state history is created without the instance being started.

  • StateMachineWorkflow

    Gets the latest definition of the StateMachineWorkflowActivity.

    public System.Workflow.Activities.StateMachineWorkflowActivity StateMachineWorkflow { get; }

    Property Value

    • StateMachineWorkflowActivity

      The latest definition of the StateMachineWorkflowActivity.

    Exceptions

    • InvalidOperationException

      If the workflow has already completed, the current StateMachineWorkflowActivity cannot be retrieved, so the previous definition is retrieved.

    Remarks

    This property only returns a copy of the workflow definition and never the live instance tree. Therefore, the activity tree that is returned by this property cannot be used to query for run-time values.

  • States

    Gets a list of StateActivity classes in the stem.Workflow.Activities.StateMachineWorkflowInstance.StateMachineWorkflow*.

    public System.Collections.ObjectModel.ReadOnlyCollection<System.Workflow.Activities.StateActivity> States { get; }

    Property Value

    • ReadOnlyCollection<StateActivity>

      A list of StateActivity classes in the stem.Workflow.Activities.StateMachineWorkflowInstance.StateMachineWorkflow*.

    Exceptions

    • InvalidOperationException

      The stem.Workflow.Activities.StateMachineWorkflowInstance.StateMachineWorkflow* is a null reference (Nothing in Visual Basic).

  • WorkflowInstance

    Gets the current WorkflowInstance.

    public System.Workflow.Runtime.WorkflowInstance WorkflowInstance { get; }

    Property Value

    • WorkflowInstance

      The current WorkflowInstance.

Methods

    Posts a message to the StateMachineWorkflowInstance.

    public void EnqueueItem (IComparable queueName, object item);

    Parameters

    • queueName
      IComparable

      The name of the workflow queue.

    • item

      The object to queue.

  • EnqueueItem(IComparable,Object,IPendingWork,Object)

    Posts a message to the StateMachineWorkflowInstance.

    public void EnqueueItem (IComparable queueName, object item, System.Workflow.Runtime.IPendingWork pendingWork, object workItem);

    Parameters

    • queueName
      IComparable

      The name of the workflow queue.

    • item
      System.Object

      The object to queue.

    • pendingWork
      IPendingWork

      An IPendingWork that allows the sender to be notified when the item is delivered.

    • workItem
      System.Object

      An object to be passed to the IPendingWork methods.

  • SetState(String)

    Provides a transition to a specified StateActivity using the name of the StateActivity.

    public void SetState (string targetStateName);

    Parameters

    • targetStateName
      String

      The name of the StateActivity to transition to.

    Exceptions

    • ArgumentNullException

      targetStateName is a null reference (Nothing in Visual Basic).

    • ArgumentOutOfRangeException

      The StateActivity specified by targetStateName is a null reference (Nothing).

  • SetState(StateActivity)

    Provides a transition to a specified StateActivity.

    public void SetState (System.Workflow.Activities.StateActivity targetState);

    Parameters

    • targetState
      StateActivity

      The StateActivity to transition to.

    Exceptions

    • ArgumentNullException

      targetState is a null reference (Nothing in Visual Basic).
